ngiemboon: Á laa fʉʼó ŋwɛ́, epʉ̀a metsèm ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, é shwóŋe pɔ́ tàʼ ntí, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin tàʼa shwóŋè.
en: The whole earth had the same language and vocabulary.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la fó shÿó sǎʼnèm ńgʉa ńtsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ fúʼ, á láʼa Shʉneya.
en: As people migrated from the east,   they found a valley in the land of Shinar and settled there.  # 11:2 Gn 10:10; 14:1; Dn 1:2

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kwaŋte tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b ngie: «Pege záʼa tsǎʼ, ńtuɔ!» Pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn ńge lɔg membʉ̀ tsǎʼ gÿo, é gÿo metǒon lɔg ńkwɛ́ ndá, é piŋ lɔgɔ kuntâg, é gÿo pòlopólo.
en: They said to each other, “Come, let’s make oven-fired bricks.” (They used brick for stone and asphalt   for mortar.)

ngiemboon: Ḿbiŋ ńgíŋe ńgɔɔn ngie: «Pege kwɛ́ɛ tàʼa tÿǒsoŋ, ńgʉa tsoló ḿbwóon tàʼ shʉ̀shʉ̀a ndá ndêg gie ntsɔ̀ʼ ye ge kíbe lefaŋ. À cʉa púʼu, mé zsé wégè, pege néŋe tàʼa jʉʼ, tà pege le gíŋe ńnéŋe pɔ́ mejʉʼ mejʉʼ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ wɔ́.»
en: And they said, “Come, let’s build ourselves a city and a tower with its top in the sky.   Let’s make a name for ourselves; otherwise, we will be scattered throughout the earth.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a fó tÿǒ lepwó sẅɛ́ʼ, légyá tÿǒsoŋ pɔ́ shʉ̀shʉ̀a ndá ndêg gie pʉ̀a mesoŋ la ne ńkwɛ́ɛ.
en: Then the Lord came down   to look over the city and the tower that the humans  # 11:5 Or the descendants of Adam were building.

ngiemboon: Ńgyá púʼu, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Anò yɔɔn! Pɔ́ pɛ̂ ńgwɔ́ tàʼa láʼ gie á shwóŋè pɔ́ tàʼ ntí, ḿbiŋ ńgẅiin tàʼa shwóŋè. Á lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie pɔ́ zyeté pɛ́ʼɛ̀, mbà tsɔ́ mmó té wó gie ngwɔ́, á gÿo ńtáte wɔ́b légÿo mmó gie pɔ́ ka kwaŋ wɔ́.
en: The Lord said, “If they have begun to do this as one people all having the same language, then nothing they plan to do will be impossible for them.

ngiemboon: Pege sẅɛ́ʼɛ ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, ńnéŋe fàgte na shwóŋè yɔ́b, tà nyìŋ le gíŋe ńjúʼu shwóŋè wetsɔ̌ wɔ́.»
en: Come, let’s go down there and confuse their language so that they will not understand one another’s speech.”

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a fó jʉʼó ńtága wɔ́b, ńnáa wɔ́b meshÿó meshÿó ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ, tà pɔ́ pú ńgwáʼa fàʼa lékwɛ́ɛ tÿǒsoŋ.
en: So from there the Lord scattered them throughout the earth,   and they stopped building the city.

ngiemboon: Yɔɔn áa mmó gie á la gÿo, mé tóŋo yɛ̌ tÿǒsoŋ lê Mbabɛɛ; ńtí nue Cʉ̀apʉ̀a la néŋe fàgte na shwóŋè pʉ̀a mesoŋ, à la gíŋe fó pɔ́ jʉʼó ńtága wɔ́b, ńnáa meshÿó meshÿó ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ.
en: Therefore it is called Babylon,  ,# 11:9 In Hb, the name for “Babylon,” babel sounds like the word for “confuse,” balal.,# 11:9 Gn 10:10 for there the Lord confused the language of the whole earth, and from there the Lord scattered them throughout the earth.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée mezíŋ pʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀ Sɛm. Sɛm la gẅiin ngùʼ nkÿo, ńzyé múɔ mbàŋa, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Alepashÿad. Á la gwaa gwɔ́ mbà é gwɔ̌ ngùʼ pʉ́a, páʼ mentse mie é la kwɔ́ʼ ḿbú ńjÿó jʉʼ la mag.
en: These are the family records   of Shem. Shem lived 100 years and fathered Arpachshad two years after the flood.

ngiemboon: Sem la zyé Alepashÿad, ńgíŋe ńtsẅé ndùm njÿó ngùʼ nkÿo tʉ̂a. Ńgwaa tsẅé púʼu, ńgíŋe ńzyé tsɔ́ púɔ mbàŋa mbɔɔ púɔ panzwě.
en: After he fathered Arpachshad, Shem lived 500 years and fathered other sons and daughters.

ngiemboon: Alepashÿad la gẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b tʉ̂a lé móm tá, ńzyé múɔ mbàŋa, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Shÿélà.
en: Arpachshad lived 35 years   and fathered Shelah.

ngiemboon: À la zyé Shÿélà púʼu, ńgíŋe ńtsẅé ndùm njÿó ngùʼ tá nzèm nkÿo lekùɔ. Ńgwaa tsẅé púʼu, ńgíŋe ńzyé tsɔ́ púɔ mbàŋa mbɔɔ púɔ panzwě.
en: After he fathered Shelah, Arpachshad lived 403 years and fathered other sons and daughters.

ngiemboon: Shÿélà la gẅiin ngùʼ móm tá, ńzyé múɔ mbàŋa, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Ébɛ̀.
en: Shelah lived 30 years and fathered Eber.

ngiemboon: À la zyé Ébɛ̀, ńgíŋe ńtsẅé ndùm njÿó ngùʼ tá nzèm nkÿo lekùɔ. Ńgwaa tsẅé púʼu, ńgíŋe ńzyé tsɔ́ púɔ mbàŋa mbɔɔ púɔ panzwě.
en: After he fathered Eber, Shelah lived 403 years and fathered other sons and daughters.

ngiemboon: Ébɛ̀ la gẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lekùɔ lé móm tá, ńzyé múɔ mbàŋa, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Pelɛg.
en: Eber lived 34 years and fathered Peleg.

ngiemboon: À la zyé Pelɛg, ńgíŋe ńtsẅé ndùm njÿó ngùʼ móm tá nzèm nkÿo lekùɔ. Ńgwaa tsẅé púʼu, ńgíŋe ńzyé tsɔ́ púɔ mbàŋa mbɔɔ púɔ panzwě.
en: After he fathered Peleg, Eber lived 430 years and fathered other sons and daughters.

ngiemboon: Pelɛg la gẅiin ngùʼ móm tá, ńzyé múɔ mbàŋa, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Leu.
en: Peleg lived 30 years and fathered Reu.

ngiemboon: À la zyé Leu, ńgíŋe ńtsẅé ndùm njÿó ngùʼ lepfwɔʼɔ́ nzèm nkÿo pʉ́a. Ńgwaa tsẅé púʼu, ńgíŋe ńzyé tsɔ́ púɔ mbàŋa mbɔɔ púɔ panzwě.
en: After he fathered Reu, Peleg lived 209 years and fathered other sons and daughters.

ngiemboon: Leu la gẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b pʉ́a lé móm tá, ńzyé múɔ mbàŋa, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Selug.
en: Reu lived 32 years and fathered Serug.

ngiemboon: À la zyé Selug, ńgíŋe ńtsẅé ndùm njÿó ngùʼ sɔɔnmbʉ́a nzèm nkÿo pʉ́a. Ńgwaa tsẅé púʼu, ńgíŋe ńzyé tsɔ́ púɔ mbàŋa mbɔɔ púɔ panzwě.
en: After he fathered Serug, Reu lived 207 years and fathered other sons and daughters.

ngiemboon: Selug la gẅiin ngùʼ móm tá, ńzyé múɔ mbàŋa, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Nahɔɔ.
en: Serug lived 30 years and fathered Nahor.

ngiemboon: À la zyé Nahɔɔ, ńgíŋe ńtsẅé ndùm njÿó ngùʼ nkÿo pʉ́a. Ńgwaa tsẅé púʼu, ńgíŋe ńzyé tsɔ́ púɔ mbàŋa mbɔɔ púɔ panzwě.
en: After he fathered Nahor, Serug lived 200 years and fathered other sons and daughters.

ngiemboon: Nahɔɔ la gẅiin ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔʼɔ́ lé móm mbʉ́a, ńzyé múɔ mbàŋa, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Télà.
en: Nahor lived 29 years and fathered Terah.

ngiemboon: À la zyé Télà, ńgíŋe ńtsẅé ndùm njÿó ngùʼ ntsɔ̀b lepfwɔʼɔ́ né legém nzèm nkÿo. Ńgwaa tsẅé púʼu, ńgíŋe ńzyé tsɔ́ púɔ mbàŋa mbɔɔ púɔ panzwě.
en: After he fathered Terah, Nahor lived 119 years and fathered other sons and daughters.

ngiemboon: Télà la gwɔ́ tà ńgẅiin ngùʼ móm sɔɔnmbʉ́a, ńzyé púɔ mbàŋa méntá: wɔɔn laa Ábalam, wɔɔn gwɔ́ Nahɔɔ ńgÿo Alaŋ.
en: Terah lived 70 years and fathered Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

ngiemboon: Mɔɔn ée mezíŋ pʉ̀a na ngẅɛ̀ Télà, tá pa Ábalam, pɔ́ Nahɔɔ né Alaŋ. Alaŋ la zyé tàʼ múɔ mbàŋa, ńtsẅi lezíŋ sé lê Lɔ̂d.
en: These are the family records of Terah. Terah fathered Abram, Nahor, and Haran, and Haran fathered Lot.

ngiemboon: Alaŋ la gwaa kwé, á jʉʼ gie mé zyé yé wó, á Ûu tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Shÿâandê, tá we Télà nyé ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ wó.
en: Haran died in his native land, in Ur of the Chaldeans, during his father Terah’s lifetime.

ngiemboon: Ábalam la zɔ́ʼɔ Salayi, Nahɔɔ zɔ́ʼɔ Mileka, míŋ Alaŋ. Alaŋ la gíŋe ńgwɔ́ tá pa Iseka.
en: Abram and Nahor took wives: Abram’s wife was named Sarai,   and Nahor’s wife was named Milcah.  # 11:29 Gn 22:20,23; 24:15 She was the daughter of Haran, the father of both Milcah and Iscah.

ngiemboon: Salayi la te múɔ gẅiin, ńtí nue à laa nkǐŋ.
en: Sarai was unable to conceive;   she did not have a child.

ngiemboon: Télà la cʉ́ʼʉ léfó Ûu, á tsɛ̀ɛ láʼa Shÿâandê gee láʼa Kánàhan, ńdɔgɔ Ábalam pɔ́ míŋ míŋ we Lɔ̂d gẅie kwaʼ tá we aa Alaŋ ńgʉa. À la gíŋe ńdɔgɔ Salayi gẅie à la nzwě míŋ we Ábalam ńgʉa. Pɔ́ la giŋ tà ńkúu tÿǒsoŋ Alaŋ ńnéŋe wó.
en: Terah took his son Abram, his grandson Lot (Haran’s son), and his daughter-in-law Sarai, his son Abram’s wife, and they set out together from Ur of the Chaldeans   to go to the land of Canaan. But when they came to Haran, they settled there.

ngiemboon: Télà tǎa ńkwé pɔ́ wó, ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà à gẅǐin ngùʼ tʉ̂a nzèm nkÿo pʉ́a.
en: Terah lived 205 years and died in Haran.
